Text: Augie ENewsENEWS October Volume Number Augie ENews is a bimonthly or as needed newsletter sent to alumni of Augustana College informing them of the latest news from campus Viking Days Thanks for Coming Home October was quite the weekend for Augustana It began with the inauguration of Dr Bruce Halverson as Augustanas nd President Cold weather didnt keep alumni away from the parade And the football game against NDSU was a good fight We inducted the Class of into the Honor Guard at the Heritage Honor Luncheon and honored outstanding individuals at the Athletic Hall of Fame Banquet on Friday night and at the Alumni Banquet on Saturday night Viking Varieties was a hit in the Sioux Falls Arena and the crowd was great at the Afterglow complete with music by President Halverson and the Fabulous Jadesmen and Doc Krueger and the Alumni Brass Choir Click on alumnihomecominghtml for pictures from the weekend Class pictures can be found at the Reunions Site under each class year Plan now to attend Viking Days October The Classes of and will celebrate reunions Joel Wudel resigns as Director of Alumni Relations Paul Krueger is Promoted Effective October Joel Wudel is no longer at Augustana He is moving on to other endeavors in Kansas City MO Wellwishes can be sent to his home at S Quail Run Ave Sioux Falls SD Paul Krueger who has been Associate Director of Alumni Relations the last three years has assumed Joels position Paul graduated from Augustana in with majors in journalism and communications He was student body president his senior year and involved in many other campus activities Pauls wife Joni works in the Admission Office at Augie Paul can be reached at or at Augustana and WYNCOM Inc present The Fifth Annual Worldwide Lessons in Leadership Series The worlds largest training conference focuses on rapid change and strategies for success Entitled The Brave New Workplace Strategies to Excel in a World of Change the program will be available throughout the world via satellite on November Augustana joins FORTUNE Magazine as the exclusive local hosts for this program This extraordinary program features personal insights from Nobel Peace Prize winner Nelson Mandela It continues with the latest strategies from Dr Stephen Covey Dr Tom Peters Dr Ken Blanchard Dr Martha Rogers and Don Tapscott There will also be an executive panel featuring Martha Stewart Intel founder Andy Grove and Yahoo founder Jerry Yang The program begins at am in Sioux Falls and will be held at the Sioux Falls Convention Center For time and location details for Augie alums in other parts of the country for more information or to register please visit the online program information at wwwwyncom or call Christmas Vespers Tickets Available Tickets are available for Christmas Vespers which will be December They are per person and can be purchased with a credit card by calling the Augustana Box Office at You can also stop by the Box Office during regular business hours Performances are Friday December at pm at First Lutheran Church Saturday December at and pm at First Lutheran Church and Sunday December at and pm at Saint Joseph Cathedral Augie Volleyball Team Continues Winning Streak The Augie Volleyball team continues to be ranked in the national Div II rankings The team is overall and in the North Central Conference The team travels to Brookings on October to battle th ranked SDSU Recently the Vikings swept Saint Cloud State and Minnesota State Mankato The team has set a record for consecutive wins with The previous record of was set a year ago Follow volleyball and all Augie athletics on the web at wwwaugieeduathletics Email the Augustana Alumni Office at Our phone number is

Augie ENewsENEWS November Volume Number Augie ENews is a monthly or as needed newsletter sent to alumni of Augustana College informing them of the latest news from campus Augustana Volleyball Team Makes Elite Eight and Will Host National Tournament The Augustana Vikings captured the NCAA Division II North Central Region championship November and will host the Elite Eight national championship tournament November December All matches will be played in the Elmen Center To win Regionals Augie first defeated the University of Northern Colorado and went on to beat South Dakota State University in three games The Vikings play West Texas A M on Thursday November at pm Augustana with a record of gave West Texas A M their only loss earlier in the year For more information on the Tournament go to newspressrelindexhtml Come cheer on the Vikings as they fight for the national title Follow the tournament on the web at athleticsindexhtml Rev Doug Olson Named Vice President for Advancement After a national search President Bruce Halverson announced that Rev Doug Olson has been named Vice President for Advancement at Augustana Olson currently lives in Omaha NE where he Vice President for Development at the Nebraska Methodist Hospital Foundation Olson is the current President of the Augustana Alumni Association He replaces Keith Christensen who left Augustana for Luther College in July Olson will be responsible for all college functions related to development alumni and marketing He will also join the four other vice presidents and ranking faculty in providing leadership in the Presidents Cabinet Olsons wife Kelly also graduated from Augustana Their daughter Megan is a freshman at Augustana and their son Dan is a sophomore in high school Olson begins his duties January Queen Noor of Jordan to be the Next Boe Forum Speaker Augustanas Center for Western Studies announced that Her Majesty Queen Noor of Jordan will be the next Boe Forum speaker on May She is the widow of the late King Hussein of Jordan Noor was born Lisa Najeeb Halaby in She attended schools in Los Angeles Washington DC New York City and Concord Academy in Massachussetts That was before she entered Princeton in its first coeducational freshman class She graduated from Princeton in with a degree in architecture and urban planning Since then Queen Noor has actively traveled volunteered and lectured throughout the world on various topics including mother and child health care education environmental protection culture and womens development The presentation is free and open to the public Tickets are required for admission and will be available at the Center for Western Studies in April Viking Football Players Named to AllNCC Team Senior quarterback Eric DeGraff Alleman Iowa junior wide receivers Matt Holmlund Benson Minn and Ryan Nodland Alexandria Minn and senior offensive linemen Ryan Sather Anoka Minn and Ryan Stadum Little Falls Minn were named to the AllNorth Central Conference first team chosen by the leagues coaches Senior defensive back Roman Evans Lincoln Neb was named to the second team Honorable mention choices were senior defensive back Lucas VanGilder Watertown SD sophomore defensive lineman Nate Fluit Larchwood Iowa and junior linebacker Joe Evenson Garretson SD The Vikings finish was their first winning record since the team posted an mark This years finish in conference play was the first winning mark in the league since the team went Christmas Vespers Tickets Available Tickets are still available for Christmas Vespers which will be December They are per person and can be purchased with a credit card by calling the Augustana Box Office at You can also stop by the Box Office during regular business hours Services are Friday December at pm at First Lutheran Church Saturday December at and pm at First Lutheran Church and Sunday December at sold out and pm at Saint Joseph Cathedral Have a wonderful Thanksgiving holiday Email the Augustana Alumni Office at Our phone number is
